Workflow.WorkStageName: Need to register a **new collateral code**? Y/N

The function of this screen is to **register detailed collateral information** provided by customers.

① The system supports various types of collateral, including **real estate (machinery)**, **movables**, **deposits**, **letters of credit**, and **securities**.
② Each collateral must be registered **individually**.
③ For **deposit-based collateral**, if the deposit is held within the bank, the **pledge registration and release** processes are managed **automatically**.

This screen ensures **accurate and efficient management** of customer-provided collateral data for compliance and operational needs.

The function of this screen is to view registered **collateral** records and **link them to loans**.

It allows users to:
① Classify and review **re-evaluation methods**,
② Select **collateral evaluation methods**,
③ Determine and confirm **priority rankings** and related details.

This screen provides comprehensive management of collateral linking processes, ensuring precise and systematic handling of **loan-collateral connections**.

The function of this screen is to **register and update collateral information** by reflecting the **latest appraised value** of the collateral.

① **Register** the appraisal information of collateral items.
② **Update** existing collateral information to ensure it aligns with the most recent appraised values.
This ensures accurate and up-to-date **collateral management** for appraisal purposes.

The function of this screen is to **register details of pledges and mortgages** associated with collateral.

① **Record** information about the establishment of **pledges** and **mortgage** for collateral items.
② Ensure accurate documentation of the registration process for legal and financial management.

This functionality provides a streamlined interface for securely managing **pledge and mortgage registration details**, ensuring compliance with legal and operational requirements.

The function of this screen is to **create and manage new collateral classification codes** when the required type of collateral code is not available in the system.

① Users can input details to register a **new collateral code**.
② The system validates the input to ensure accuracy and compliance.
③ Once registered, the newly created collateral code becomes available for use in relevant processes.

This feature allows for efficient and precise updates to the system, ensuring all required collateral types are properly categorized and accessible.

(**China branches** only)
Send data to **CBIRC**?
Y/N

The function of this screen is to **register collateral information** for **CBIRC** data transmission.

① This screen is used by all branches in **China** to input and manage collateral-related details for accurate submission to **CBRIC**.
② Specifically, it ensures that collateral appraisal information is entered or updated through **Transaction Code 430900** to maintain **data accuracy**.
③ This process is essential to send correct and complete collateral data to the **Shanghai CBIRC system**, aligning with regulatory requirements.
Nead a **new code** for the **guarantor relationship**? Y/N?"

The function of this screen is to **register a new guarantor** in the system.
Registered guarantors can later be linked to loan accounts through the **[432200] Link Guarantor** screen.

① Use this screen to input and save guarantor details.
② Once saved, guarantors are made available for selection and association with loan accounts.

The function of this screen is to **link registered guarantors** to **loan applications** using the associated **loan approval number**.

① Search for a guarantor registered in the system.
② Enter or select the corresponding **loan approval number**.
③ Establish the link between the guarantor and the loan application.

This screen enables precise and efficient management of guarantor information by ensuring their connection to specific loans.

The function of this screen is to **create and register a new Relationship Code** that defines additional types of guarantor-debtor relationships beyond those already available in the system.

① Users can generate **new relationship codes** as needed.
② The screen provides options to input and save details for these custom relationship types.

This functionality ensures the system can accommodate diverse guarantor-debtor relationship categories, enhancing its flexibility and usability.

If a customer's credit deteriorates or a loan becomes **delinquent** and is deemed **uncollectible**,

the bank **registers the collateral** designated for loan repayment with the **court**. This is done to facilitate disposal through auction, public sale, or other means of liquidation.
